verses.verse: And they shall bear their iniquity; the punishment of the prophet shall be the same as the punishment of the one who inquired,

that the house of Israel may (Ps. 119:67, 71; Jer. 31:18, 19; (Heb. 12:11); 2 Pet. 2:15) no longer stray from Me, nor be profaned anymore with all their transgressions, (Ezek. 11:20; 37:27) but that they may be My people and I may be their God,“ says the Lord GOD.’ ”
(Judgment on Persistent Unfaithfulness) The word of the LORD came again to me, saying:

“Son of man, when a land sins against Me by persistent unfaithfulness, I will stretch out My hand against it; I will cut off its (Lev. 26:26; 2 Kin. 25:3; Is. 3:1; Jer. 52:6; Ezek. 4:16; 5:16) supply of bread, send famine on it, and cut off man and beast from it.
(Jer. 15:1) Even if these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they would deliver only themselves ((Prov. 11:4)) by their righteousness,” says the Lord GOD.
“If I cause (Lev. 26:22; Num. 21:6; Ezek. 5:17; 14:21) wild beasts to pass through the land, and they empty it, and make it so desolate that no man may pass through because of the beasts,

even (Ezek. 14:14, 18, 20) though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters; only they would be delivered, and the land would be (Ezek. 15:8; 33:28, 29) desolate.
“Or if (Lev. 26:25; Ezek. 5:12; 21:3, 4; 29:8; 38:21) I bring a sword on that land, and say, ‘Sword, go through the land,’ and I (Ezek. 25:13; Zeph. 1:3) cut off man and beast from it,
